arts.ttl: Bristol Rovers 1 Exeter City 2 - Grecians grind out win over Westcountry rivals - Devon Live
arts.sum: Exeter City made it a very Happy Birthday for manager Gary Caldwell as they produced an impressive away performance to beat Bristol Rovers. Exeter City: Joe Whitworth, Ed Turns, Jack Fitzwater, Alex Hartridge, Jack McMillan, Reece Cole (Joel Colwill, 60), Kevin McDonald (Ryan Woods, 60), Ilmari Niskanen, Tony Yogane (Vincent Harper, 60), Caleb Watts (Ed Francis, 75), Sonny Cox (Angus MacDonald, 86)

arts.ttl: Bristol Rovers drop into bottom four after losing run continues against Exeter
Exeter City aim to take advantage of struggling Bristol Rovers' nerves
arts.sum: “They’re a team that’s below us, so they’re going to be doing everything they can to try and win the game and close the (seven point) gap on us. Rovers, who have seen little improvement in results or form since sacking former Grecians boss Matt Taylor and replacing him with Inigo Calderon in December, are on a run of five straight defeats and have collected just 20 points from 21 games since the Spaniard’s appointment.

arts.ttl: Exeter City 'deserve more credit' for way Grecians gelled since January
arts.sum: “I think the players deserve so much credit for the second half of the season, the way we’ve played and come together in a short space of time, so to get over that would be brilliant and potentially get more points than last year would be a huge achievement for this team at this level, considering the league this year and the strength and the depth that the league has had. “Walsall lost their best striker (loanee Nathan Lowe, who scored 18 goals in 30 appearances before returning to Stoke City) and they have absolutely collapsed in the second half of the season (Walsall were 12 points clear at the top of League Two and they are now third in the standings) and that’s what happens when you lose key players in any team at any level.

arts.ttl: Exeter City Women travel to Hashtag United in battle for high finish
arts.sum: Exeter City Women travel to Hashtag United this Sunday for their final away game of the season, with both sides looking for three points to keep them as high up the league table as possible. City know their targets and want to finish as high up the table as possible and will have to be at their best to return to Devon with points come Sunday night, but with the belief currently coursing through the team, anything is possible.

Bristol Rovers might sit one spot above the relegation zone, but five defeats on the bounce mean they're in serious danger of going down. With Wrexham to come on Good Friday, the Pirates desperately ...

arts.ttl: Reece Cole set Exeter City challenge after season of struggle
arts.sum: Injuries have limited him to just 22 appearances and only six starts this season, but on his first league start since he scored his only other goal this campaign in a 2-1 home defeat to Peterborough United in August, Cole popped up with a downward volley that looped into the top corner to earn the Grecians a well-deserved point against the Latics. EXETER City supporters will have gone to bed on Tuesday night with the ‘Reece Cole again, ole ole’ chant ringing in their ears and manager Gary Caldwell was full of praise for the midfielder, who struck the second half equaliser in the 1-1 League One draw with Wigan Athletic.

arts.ttl: Preview: Bristol Rovers vs. Exeter City - prediction, team news, lineups
arts.sum: Sports Mole previews Saturday's League One clash between Bristol Rovers and Exeter City, including predictions, team news and possible lineups.

arts.ttl: I should be back fit and ready for my testimonial season with Exeter City
arts.sum: Since I last put pen to paper, we’ve enjoyed a fantastic 2-1 win at Barnsley last Tuesday and endured a disappointing 2-0 defeat at home to Stockport on Saturday. Having just gone under the surgeon’s knife, I’m happy to report the surgery to fix my long-standing hip issue went entirely to plan and, assuming there are no unforeseen complications, there’s no reason why I shouldn’t play a full part in the forthcoming pre-season.
